entry.title: New release for Mantium: v2.0.0 - Custom Manga and Multimanga
entry.content:
Custom Manga

With the addition of the custom manga feature, now Mantium allows you to add mangas, manhwa, light novels, etc. that aren't from one of the supported source sites. You must manually track these manga, providing info about them like name, URL, cover image, etc. You can also provide the next chapter you should read from the manga, and update it every time you read a chapter.

When you read the last available chapter from a custom manga, check the "No more chapters available" checkbox so the manga is considered read instead of unread.

Multimanga

The multimanga feature solves the issue of when you want to track the same manga in multiple sources so that you are notified whenever a new chapter is released as soon as possible in whatever source. Previously, you would need to add the same manga from different sources, but they would act as completely different mangas. You would need to manually set the last read chapter for all of them and be notified for all of them.

The multimanga feature solves this issue by allowing you to track the same manga from multiple sources, with them being treated as the same manga. No multiple notifications or setting the last read chapter for all of them! - A deeper explanation of the multimanga feature and a demo video can be found here.

The image below shows the popup to manage the mangas of a multimanga.

Other changes

  • Added: Route /v1/manga/metadata to get manga metadata from the source site.
  • Changed: Notification format. Send only the last released chapter.
  • Changed: Send all notifications at the same time.
  • Changed: MangaPlus chapter lists are now in descending order.
  • Changed: Default last read chapter for new mangas is none.
  • Fix: Dashboard sort options.
  • Fix: Some bugfixes.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/diogovalentte/mantium/compare/v1.0.1...v2.0.0

entry.title: New release for Mantium: v3.0.0 - Everything is a multimanga now
entry.content:
Changed

  • All mangas (except the custom mangas) are now multimangas!.
  • Improve forms.
  • Performance improvements by improving SQL queries.
  • Limits the size of the background error shown in the dashboard.
  • Add warning in the update form when the user changed the cover image to a custom one.
  • Prevents dashboard rerun when user is interacting with a form.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/diogovalentte/mantium/compare/v2.0.5...v3.0.0

entry.title: New release for Mantium: v3.5.0 - Add Suwayomi integration
entry.content:
Suwayomi Integration

An integration with Suwayomi was added. The integration will:

  • Try to add the manga to Suwayomi when you add it to the dashboard.
    • Only the original manga of a multimanga will be added to Suwayomi. Mangas added to a multimanga later are not automatically added to Suwayomi.
  • If the background job to update the mangas metadata detects newly released chapters, it will enqueue the chapter to be downloaded by Suwayomi.
  • If there are already mangas on your dashboard, the API has a route to add your mangas to Suwayomi. To know more, check the API docs.

Check the Suwayomi integration doc to know more about how to use the integration!

More settings

The dashboard settings menu was updated, and two more settings were added: - Add multimanga mangas to download integrations: By default, add only the multimangas' first manga to download integrations. If checked, when adding additional mangas to a multimanga, add them to download integrations too. - Enqueue chapters to download when adding manga to Suwayomi: By default, enqueue to download all chapters from the mangas that are added to the Suwayomi integration (except ComicK mangas).

Other

  • changed: update the API route that updates dashboard configs.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/diogovalentte/mantium/compare/v3.4.3...v3.5.0

entry.title: New release for Mantium: v4.0.0 - BREAKING: Store Settings in DB
entry.content:
BREAKING CHANGE: store settings in DB instead of configs file

Settings that were previously stored in the configs.json file are now stored in the database. The API container will throw an error if it detects a configs.json file, so please remove it and set the settings in the dashboard again.

Configure allowed sources and adding methods

Two new environment variables were added: - ALLOWED_SOURCES: specifies which sources are allowed to add mangas from. It should be a list of sources separated by comma. Defaults to allowing all sources. Example: mangadex,comick,mangahub,mangaplus,mangaupdates,rawkuma,klmanga,jmanga. - ALLOWED_ADDING_METHODS: specifies which adding methods should be available in the dashboard. Defaults to allowing all methods. Example: Search,URL.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/diogovalentte/mantium/compare/v3.5.1...v4.0.0
